alert.note: Alert for Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:02PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Lewis and Clark, south central Teton and northwestern Cascade Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 601 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Augusta, or 22 miles southwest of Choteau, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Choteau, Fairfield, Augusta, Nilan Reservoir and Pishkun Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Highway 287 between mile markers 35 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 21 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central, north central and west central Montana.
